CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 15, 1952, pg. 25, reads: "YMCA Soap Sale Drive - Judge Homer S. Brown buys the first cake of soap to begin the YMCA drive to have boys help themselves to earn money for a trip to summer camp, to buy a YMCA 'T' shirt, or a 'Y' membership. Beginning this week, members of the Gra-Y Clubs of Weil, Madison, Vann will canvass the community in effort.  Left to right: Al Tindall, YMCA boy's work secretary; Judge Homer S. Brown, Eugene Stevens, and C. A. Fonner, Swift soap salesman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of unknown boy holding box of soap labeled "YMCA Camp," Al Tindall, Judge Homer S. Brown, Eugene Stevens, and C. A. Fonner, posed for fundraiser in YMCA, horizontal version
